premises: If a star is massive, it ends its life as a supernova
conclusions: A star ends its life as a supernova
incorrect conclusions: A star does not end its life as a supernova
A star ends its life as a supernova implies that a star is massive
A star does not end its life as a supernova implies that a star is massive
A star is not massive implies that a star does not end its life as a supernova

premises: If a planet is in the habitable zone, it can support liquid water
A planet is in the habitable zone
conclusions: A planet can support liquid water
incorrect conclusions: A planet cannot support liquid water
A planet can support liquid water implies that a planet is in the habitable zone
A planet cannot support liquid water implies that a planet is in the habitable zone
A planet is not in the habitable zone implies that a planet cannot support liquid water

premises: If the night sky is clear, you can see the Milky Way
conclusions: You can see the Milky Way
incorrect conclusions: You cannot see the Milky Way
You can see the Milky Way implies that the night sky is clear
You cannot see the Milky Way implies that the night sky is clear
The night sky is not clear implies that you cannot see the Milky Way
